# [`library()`]{.blue}

	[library]{.blue}(*package*){.center}
# What it does 

+ The library [`library()`]{.blue} function loads a package into working memory (from long term storage on your hard disk drive or solid state drive).
 
# Demo code 
	```{r eval=FALSE}	library(survial)	```	 
# Usefull stuff 
	+ There are a few "meta" packages, like `tidymodels` and `tidyverse`, which load many packages from a single .blue[`library()`] function call.	???	stats::filter and dplyr::filter	---
